summary: A limited liability company (LLC) protests the Department of Revenue’s (Department) use of an appraised value to determine the selling price of real property owned by the LLC for real estate excise tax (REET) purposes. The LLC also protests the assessment of a delinquency penalty for failing to report the REET-taxable controlling interest taxable transfer until six months after the date of transfer. Taxpayer’s petition . . . is denied.
